comment.author: 22919283@N03
comment._content:
Swimming was the first event for women in the modern Olympics.  It was introduced in the 1912 Stockholm Olympics.  

Walter Brickett was a swimming trainer for the 1908 and 1912 Olympics

This was most likely taken in 1912 near the time of  the Olympics

comment.author: 34621258@N08
comment._content: Walter Brickett is the man on the far left - he was British Olympic Swimming coach 1908 & 1912.

comment.author: 35502762@N06
comment._content: Oh my gosh! How bizzare! Walter is my great great grandfather...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks Deirdre for for identifying Walter Brickett as the man on the LEFT, rather than on the right as noted in the photograph.  We will correct the caption next time we update the record.

comment.author: 45899303@N02
comment._content: Walter Brickett is also my grand grandfather too!! wow we're related ,small world right!

comment.author: 35502762@N06
comment._content:
Hi Henry! Ha ha, we've just read your comment with the family recovering around the christmas dinner table, after a HUGE meal. My grandma is Walter Sydeny's Daughter, the oldest son of Walter Septimus. How interesting, please drop a line to patricia_snook1894@yahoo.com if you'd like to have a chat. My grandmother is very interested, and amazed that you can connect so easily online! 

Festive wishes!

comment.author: 12119698@N00
comment._content: Your comment brings a story to every picture. This way of browsing the photographs are far superior to the LOC Archive site. Thanks you all.
